title: Endgame The Final Holy War
opening: Seliph's long journey is drawing to a close. His army's victories are a beacon of hope to the Empire's victims, and a wave of further rebellions sweeps across Jugdral. First, Silesse was wrestled back from imperial control by its citizens, and soon after Agustria's people flocked to arms, burning to fight for their country.

But Grannvale itself yet stands. Duke Brian of Dozel and the axe knights of the Grau Ritter; Duke Scorpio of Jungby and his elite archers, the Beige Ritter; and Freege's Queen Hilda and the war-mages of the Gelb Ritter stand between Seliph and the capital. Belhalla itself lurks under an eerie silence, as Ishtar and the enigmatic twelve Deadlords lie in wait to defend Prince Julius himself.

Over a year has passed since that fateful first battle in Isaach. The tragic struggle pitting kin versus kin wears on, splitting the Twelve Crusaders between the light and the dark... So begins the final holy war…

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Father died, you say...

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: The Emperor had long served his purpose, Your Majesty. He was little more than an obstacle to your ambitions. He had to die.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Pfeh. I almost feel sorry for him. All his life he was your tool, Manfroy, only to be thrown away so casually...

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: All in your empire's name, Your Majesty. Arvis was a lost cause. To think he, a man of Loptous's blood, dared to challenge the revival of the empire! The righteous heart of the crusader Vala burned too fiercely within him. It was only a matter of time until he turned on you.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: I know, I know... Now, then. I hear those rebels have stumbled as far as Chalphy. Are our defenses really that pathetic?

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Rest assured. I've already tasked Edda's Bishop Rodan and Brian of Dozel with purging Chalphy of those vermin. You've no need to worry, Your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Don't I, now... Where's Julia?

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: She awaits her end in the dungeon... You there! Bring us Princess Julia!

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Ah, Julia. It's been a while, hasn't it? Tell me, do you know who I am?

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: Julius... My brother, Julius...

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Oho! So you do still remember! I can hardly believe seven long years have passed since you slipped away.

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: I... That night is seared into my memory, clear as if it were only yesterday...

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Fehehe... Good. I trust you remember your mother's final kindness as well?

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: Who... No, what are you? That night... The night Manfroy came with that eerie black tome... Nothing was ever the same again. My real brother, the kind and caring boy I once knew and loved so, died that night. In his place stood a demon of terrifying power... My brother in name only. You... You monster... You've taken my mother and my brother from me! Who are you? WHAT are you? Why... Why must you torment us all so?!

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: I am the heir of Loptous's kin, and the inheritor of his limitless power. This world belongs rightfully to me. And you, Julia? You are the heiress to the power of Naga, my eternal foe. I cannot allow you to live any longer!

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Hold a moment, Your Majesty. I believe I have a use for this girl's power. If I may, spare her and leave her to me.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Using Naga's power to serve me? Interesting... Very interesting. Very well! I must return to Belhalla. Julia is yours, Manfroy. But be warned. Be extremely careful! Even a single mistake with her could cost me dearly.

intro.speaker: Rodan
intro.line: His Majesty has issued his command. Priest and sellsword units! Defend Edda itself with your very lives! Cavalry unit, move in on Chalphy! Reclaim our land from the rebels!

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: This is it, Seliph. The final holy war begins now.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: A holy war?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Yeah, that's what this is. Julius is descended from Loptyrian royalty, and he's been working to revive the dark empire. No matter what it takes, we must stop him.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: It feels as if you know everything, Lewyn. I'm beginning to feel left out... Please, what in the world are you talking about?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Yeah, sorry about that, Seliph. I know there's a lot I've not been telling you. I've spent over a decade on a journey to figure out the truth behind all this, and I'm finally onto a hidden bigger picture here.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: ...The bigger picture?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: It seems the old Loptyrian Empire's founder, the Bishop Galle, dedicated his youth to a world-exploring voyage across the seas. He desired nothing less than to drink the blood of a legendary beast. Even a single drop, he believed, would bestow upon any human limitless power.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Do... do you mean the dragonkin of old? It couldn't be... Is that not a myth?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: You'd think so, but... When Galle returned to Jugdral, he bore bizarre powers nobody else understood. With these powers, he set to work swaying youths across the land to aid his ambitions. Before anyone else realized, he'd raised a fell legion unflinchingly loyal to his cause.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Where, then, does Loptous enter the tale?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Odds are Loptous was a dragon himself. Every last one of Galle's heirs has borne the blood of the dragonkin. The dark powers Loptous's kin command are nothing more than the dragonkin's powers.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: And what of the Crusaders?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: I'm sure you know how the legend goes. The gods descended upon twelve warriors of the old liberators at the fortress of Darna. But...

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: But?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Sorry, Seliph, but this'll have to wait. The enemy's just about on our doorstep.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Okay, Julia. This is the treasury. Try fitting the gemstone on your circlet into that niche there.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: It worked... It really worked! There it is! The Book of Naga! And it's yours for the taking, Julia!

battle.speaker: Julia
battle.line: Wow, I... Oh! How strange... It feels so warm... It's almost as if I've known this book all my life…

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Oh, heirs to the courageous! Hear my ode to the crusaders of old.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Hear me, brave heirs to the crusaders! In your hands lies the task of proving this war to be a holy war of its own. If wisdom, courage and power be your allies, summon them now and give all you have, should you wish to prevail this day. Trust in yourselves to bring forth our destiny, one born where the two trails of light meet!

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: This is it, Tine. We're getting awfully close to Freege... Mother's old home.

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Mm, but... I have a bad feeling about this. How about you?

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Yes, I suppose... I've had nothing but hatred for Freege ever since they took you and Mother. All I've ever wanted is to crush them all for all they've done...

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: But... What about Uncle Blume, Ishtar and Ishtore? Haven't I told you about them before? They were all decent people. At the very least, they were always nice to Mother and I...

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Oh, right. It was Hilda who drove Mother to her death, wasn't it?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: It was... Even after all this time, I still hate her so much. All I want is to be the one to put an end to her myself...

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Don't worry, Tine. As long as I live, you won't have to deal with anything like that ever again. I'll protect you, no matter what!

battle-talk.speaker: Amid
battle-talk.line: This is it, Linda. We're getting awfully close to Freege... Mother's old home.

battle-talk.speaker: Linda
battle-talk.line: Mm, but... I have a bad feeling about this. How about you?

battle-talk.speaker: Amid
battle-talk.line: Yes, I suppose... I've had nothing but hatred for Freege ever since they took you and Mother. All I've ever wanted is to crush them all for all they've done…

battle-talk.speaker: Linda
battle-talk.line: Say, Amid… Mother betrayed her homeland to ally with Sigurd, right? You wouldn’t know why, would you?

battle-talk.speaker: Amid
battle-talk.line: Apparently she was really close to her sister, who died for Sigurd’s cause. That’s why she joined the army too.

battle-talk.speaker: Linda
battle-talk.line: That would be our aunt, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Amid
battle-talk.line: Yeah. That was Aunt Tailtiu.

battle-talk.speaker: Linda
battle-talk.line: Wow… She died fighting for her life… That’s… That’s so sad…

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Here ya go, Seliph!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Is this… lunch? You went and made lunch for me, Patty? Why, thank you!

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Oh, and this too!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Oh! You’ve prepared a drink as well? I swear you spoil me, Patty.

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Aaaand one more thing…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Er… Is this supposed to be a drink?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: It’s Patty’s Super Special Home-Brewed Stamina Tonic! This’ll perk ya riiiiiight up! Don’t spill any, okay?

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: O-of course…

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Here ya go, Lester!

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Oh, Patty! Am I glad to see you. I swear I was about to starve to death!

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: I thought you might be, so I packed you second and third helpings! Well? How is it?

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Mmph… Oh, it’s fantastic! You’re the best cook I’ve ever met, Patty!

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Hee hee, I bet I am!

battle-talk.speaker: Daisy
battle-talk.line: What’s going on, Dimna?

battle-talk.speaker: Dimna
battle-talk.line: Oh, Daisy… I dunno. I guess I’m feeling a bit, well, worthless…

battle-talk.speaker: Daisy
battle-talk.line: Why?

battle-talk.speaker: Dimna
battle-talk.line: It’s not just me. It’s like we normal folk may as well not even be here…

battle-talk.speaker: Daisy
battle-talk.line: Actually, yeah, now that you mention it… They don’t really seem to need us.

battle-talk.speaker: Dimna
battle-talk.line: Exactly… Y’know what? I oughta just go back home and find myself a real job.

battle-talk.speaker: Daisy
battle-talk.line: As soon as all this’s finally over, I’ll be right by your side on the way to Isaach. The war thing’s wearing me right out…

battle-talk.speaker: Dimna
battle-talk.line: Gah… We’re hopeless, aren’t we…

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Shannaaaaaaaan!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: ...Er, yeah?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Er, yeah? Nice to see you too! Look, it’s lunchtime! Made it all myself!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: ...What are you doing? This is a battlefield, not a place for a picnic.

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: But I’ve got nothing else to do! It’s not like there’s anything around here that needs my, er, light touch!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: So you thought getting in everyone’s way in the middle of a war was a good idea?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Oh… Well that was uncalled for… You can’t just throw me aside like some old bag! And to think, I spent all day slaving away in a hot kitchen just to make you lunch… Well, I guess I won’t be doing that again!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Oh, Patty… Look, I’m sorry. I went too far. Forgive me...

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Then you’ll be eating my lunch? Really? Oh, that’s a huge relief… I love you sooooo much, Shannan!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Lord Seliph...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Tine?! Stay back, please! You are ill suited for the front lines!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: All I want is to help you, Lord Seliph. Please… My power is yours!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: But I… I couldn’t bear to lose you...

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: I won’t leave your side, Lord Seliph… The thought of meeting the same fate as Lady Deirdre… It’s too painful… Please, Lord Seliph. I’ll fight at your side till the very end!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: You’re right… My apologies. How could we not be better off fighting as one? Come, Tine. We ride together. Your power will bring us victory. I know it!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Lord Seliph… Thank you!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Are you alright, milord?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I am. You’ve no need to worry about me, Tine, but you ought to take care yourself. Our foes are as fierce as we’ve ever seen!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: They are… But so long as we’re together, we’ll both be fine. I know it.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Neither of us can afford to die now. After all, the task of uniting Thracia still awaits us once we’re done here.

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Mm. I’m so glad I’ll finally have the chance to help the people of Alster.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Not only Alster, Tine… The entire kingdom. After all, you’ll be by my side as the Queen of New Thracia!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: That I will be, milord!

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Are you alright, Ced?

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Yeah, I’m fine. Don’t worry. But you ought to be careful yourself! These foes are as tough as they come.

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: They are… But so long as we’re together, we’ll both be fine. I know it.

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Tine. I love you so much. You’re the most important part of my life…

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Ced! We’re in the middle of the battle. This is hardly the time for things like that…

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Heh, sorry about that. I just wanted to say it while I still can. I’d hate to leave it unsaid should something happen…

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Ced… Please, be careful…

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: Are you alright, Asaello? Listen, I know how frustrated you are right now, but please, you mustn’t do anything too rash.

battle-talk.speaker: Asaello
battle-talk.line: Gah… If only I had a bit of crusader power, too, I wouldn’t be so bloody useless. I can’t take this!

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: I know… I’ve often thought the same. But crusader blood wouldn’t be the answer to everything. Think of it this way. We’ve made it so far with them with nothing but our best work. We might be common folk, but we’re bold and determined, and that’s what matters.

battle-talk.speaker: Asaello
battle-talk.line: Commoners… And to think, everyone around us is Lord This or Lady That or King The Other! Life’s so unfair.

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: I suppose… but come on, cheer up! Lord or not, there’s a whole orphanage eagerly awaiting your triumphant return!

battle-talk.speaker: Asaello
battle-talk.line: Yeah, you’re right. Things really aren’t all that bad. How could they be with you around?

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: Heh… Oh, Asaello…

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Lord Seliph…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Nanna, the battle before us is as brutal as they come. Please, do take extra care.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: I know, but I’m actually a bit worried for you, Lord Seliph. Don’t forget that you’ve got to take extra care as well.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: You are right, of course, but after all this time we’re finally nearing the end. I mustn’t give this any less than I have.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Then I’ll do everything I can to protect you, Lord Seliph. I’ll pray for you, just as I always have…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Nanna… I’m so grateful to have you always watching over me… I admit I can even feel your power!

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: You’re welcome, Lord Seliph…

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Say, Lord Leif… How soon do you think this fight will be over?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I cannot say for sure... And yet I cannot help but feel our triumph is drawing ever closer.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: And once this is over, I take it we’ll be headed for Leonster?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Indeed we are. The Thracian peninsula has known naught but strife for decades, and to unify it was my father’s dream. I’ll pledge my life to fulfill his grand vision, and I’d have nothing more than to have you by my side every step of the way, Nanna.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Of course Lord Leif! I’ll be by your side forevermore, wherever your path leads. Even to the very ends of the earth...

battle-talk.speaker: Jeanne
battle-talk.line: Lord Leif!

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Jeanne? Didn't I ask you to remain in the castle?

battle-talk.speaker: Jeanne
battle-talk.line: But-

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I'm sorry, but this battle is far too dangerous for anybody who's not of crusader descent. I don't want you fighting today!

battle-talk.speaker: Jeanne
battle-talk.line: I know I'd be a burden if I fought, but I've still got my staves, remember? Surely having a cleric would be a good idea?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I suppose... But stay clear of any danger. Do I make myself clear? New Thracia still needs you... I still need you. I couldn't live with myself if I let you die...

battle-talk.speaker: Jeanne
battle-talk.line: Yes, Lord Leif…

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: You need to be careful, Ares! With a task as great as Agustria’s restoration awaiting you, you can’t afford to die now.

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: Trust me, I know. I’ll never let this battle claim my life. So long as I still draw breath, I’ll toil till Father’s dying dream of a glorious Agustria is at last realized.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: That’s the Ares I know and love! Both Lord Eldigan and my mother would be so very of you. I’m sure of it.

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: But even one such as I could never do it alone. I’ll always need you, Nanna.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: And I’ll always be with you, Ares. I refuse to make the same mistake Mother made all those years ago…

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: Mistake? Was… Was Aunt Lachesis in love with my father?

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: She was. Then again, I suppose he was only her half-brother.

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: And come to think of it, we are only cousins, are we not?

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Heh… It’s no wonder we’re together.

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Hey, Seliph! Wait up!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: ...Hm? Larcei?

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: I’m coming with you on this one!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: You’re certainly welcome to…But why?

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: It’s odd… I’m actually a little scared…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Odd, indeed! If there’s one thing you’ve never been known for, Larcei, it’s fear.

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: It’s… I just…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: I understand completely. Now, come! After all, what could ever inspire courage quite like having your blade at my side?

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Seliph…

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Everything alright, Johalvier?

battle-talk.speaker: Johalvier
battle-talk.line: Nngh… I gotta admit even I’m havin’ a hard time keepin’ up… But hey, Dozel’s in our hands, right? Gotta keep going! Just a little longer…

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Don’t do anything too dumb, okay? Dozel’ll still need you around to rebuild.

battle-talk.speaker: Johalvier
battle-talk.line: Yeah, you got it. I can’t just die now and leave behind my father and brothers’ now, can I? I’ll be needin’ your help too, Larcei.

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Sure. You’ve helped me an awful lot, you know. I ought to return the favor.

battle-talk.speaker: Johalvier
battle-talk.line: Whoa, thanks! I love ya so much, Larcei.

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Wh- Johalvier! What’d I say about doing dumb things!

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Everything alright, Johan?

battle-talk.speaker: Johan
battle-talk.line: At long last, the day is upon us: a battle so fierce to test even the mettle of Johan! I know at last the stinging kiss of fatigue... But all hope is not lost! Your love is as the mightiest shield, and with it I shall endure!

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Oh, geez... I guess I deserve every stupid word of that for letting myself fall for you, huh...

battle-talk.speaker: Johan
battle-talk.line: Love's hand is beyond reproach, my dear. Come, Larcei! Bless us all with a laugh!

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Heh... Don't slack off now, Johan.

battle-talk.speaker: Johan
battle-talk.line: Ah! Oh, Larcei, my dear…

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: We’ve come quite a long way, haven’t we, Shannan?

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Yeah, I guess we have.

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: I can’t stop thinking about everyone back in Isaach… I hope they’re all alright.

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Getting a bit homesick, are we, Larcei?

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Wh… No, not even close! What, do you think I’m still some kind of child?!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Maybe. You’ve got quite a convincing child act going on there!

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: Shannan!!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Heh, I’m kidding! Come on. That terrifying glare you’ve got on there hardly befits a face as beautiful as yours.

battle-talk.speaker: Larcei
battle-talk.line: S-Shannan…

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: We're finally nearing the end, aren't we, Lord Seliph?

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Mm. You know, Lana, you've done so much to help our cause from the very beginning. I couldn't possibly thank you enough.

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Thank you, but I'm not so sure. I've hardly done anything special, have I? But I don't mind. All I really need to be happy is to be by your side, Lord Seliph.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Come to think of it, Lana, we've been together our entire lives, haven't we?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: We have! I have so many great memories of afternoons we spent playing together. But not once did I suspect we'd end up, er...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: But I've always loved you, Lana. Even when we were children.

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: I'm sorry, Lord Seliph... But I can't stop thinking about this... Something feels amiss. It's as if being with you will hurt Miss Julia...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Lana…

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Scáthach…

battle-talk.speaker: Scáthach
battle-talk.line: Yeah?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: I’m so proud of you.

battle-talk.speaker: Scáthach
battle-talk.line: Whoa, back up. Where’d THAT come from?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Please… Please don’t die in this battle.

battle-talk.speaker: Scáthach
battle-talk.line: Oh. Listen, you’ve got nothing to worry about. I’m not about to let myself die just yet.

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Scáthach, I…

battle-talk.speaker: Scáthach
battle-talk.line: Yeah?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: ...I love you, Scáthach.

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Faval…

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Yeah?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: I’m so very proud of you.

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Hey, hey, hey! What brought on the mushy stuff here?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Please… Please don’t die in this battle.

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Ah, right. Don’t worry. I’m not gonna let death do us part just yet.

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Faval, I…

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Yeah?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: ...I love you, Faval.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: That's enough Arion! Why? Why in the world do you still refuse to see reason?!

battle-talk.speaker: Arion
battle-talk.line: Altena?!

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: How could you be so craven?! How dare you place your own vanity and pride over what truly matters!

battle-talk.speaker: Arion
battle-talk.line: What do you want from me, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Take a good, hard look at Prince Seliph! Ask yourself this: why is he still fighting? For whom is he out here day after day, setting his own suffering to the side?

battle-talk.speaker: Arion
battle-talk.line: So Seliph fights for justice, and I somehow do not? Is that what you're trying to say...

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Very well, Arion... If you won't see reason, so be it. Come on. Kill me. End this. My... My life is in your hands, Arion. ...I die with no regrets.

battle-talk.speaker: Arion
battle-talk.line: A-Altena... Very well. You can rest easy now. I get it. I was wrong... My mercenary days are at an end, and my final task is with Seliph... Wait, no... With you. I now fight for you, Altena.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Say, Lord Seliph, I’ve got an idea. How about I go scout out the enemy?

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: No, that would be too great a risk. This battle is nothing like anything we’ve yet seen. I don’t want you leaving my side.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Fine…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Er… Are you worried about Silesse, Fee?

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Just a little, I guess. I’ve heard rumors about how there’s some fighting there.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Indeed! Its citizens have staged their own revolt against the Empire. From what I hear, they’ve already made impressive progress.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Really? Oh, that’s such a relief…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Would you like to return to Silesse, Fee?

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Thanks, but no thanks! The best place for me is to be by your side, Lord Seliph!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Really? Well, thank you, Fee. It’s an honor and a pleasure to hear it.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: I don’t ever want to leave you, Lord Seliph… This is like a dream come true…

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Say, Oifey, I’ve got an idea. How about I go scout out the enemy?

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Sorry, Fee, but I must object. Their lines are crawling with archers willing to shoot down any pegasi.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: So, er, Oifey…

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: ...Yes?

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Y’know, I actually think it’s really great. I mean, how all your life you’ve lived just for Lord Seliph, always putting yourself second.

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Mm… I confess that, in a way, those of us who survived the old war never truly wished to survive… But we had our own mission, painful as it was to leave our friends to their doom… Your parents among them.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Y’know, thanks to this war I’m starting to get my mom and dad a bit, and what they had to deal with… I never really knew them much… And I’m really glad I had you to tell me more about them, Oifey.

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Thank you… I feel I’ve always been indebted to Lady Erin for all the help she gave me back then. It is a privilege to help her daughter.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Um… Y’know, Oifey, I kinda wish I knew how to act a bit more, er, adulty. I think there’s a lot I could learn from you.

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: All in good time, Fee. Little by little, life itself will teach you what adulthood is.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Oh, come on! I can’t just let you get all old on me before I can catch up!

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Whoa, whoa! Settle down, Fee…

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Whatcha doing, Arthur?

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Well, for one, I’m fighting! The big hint here is the tome I’m holding… And you’re still as flighty as ever, I see.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Well, hello to you too!

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: And there you go! People are busy, and you just sulk! This sort of thing’s why nobody-

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: -will ever like me at all? That’s what you’re saying, right? Well, I don’t have to stand here and listen to this garbage!

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: No, wait! What I’m trying to say is, you sort of give people the wrong impression! But I like you… You’re really important to me..

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: A-Arthur… Stop kidding around…

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Fee, I always want to be with you. You know that. As soon as this war’s over, we’ll go back to Silesse… Together.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Oh, Arthur… Really? Yes! Thank you… Sniff… I’m… I’m so happy!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Julia! What in blazes has happened to you? Come on, wake up!

battle-talk.speaker: Julia
battle-talk.line: HA HA HA... DEATH TO ALL... WHO DARE TO CHALLENGE LORD MANFROY...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: This isn't going to work, Seliph. An evil spell's got Julia strung up like a puppet. I think we should deal with Manfroy first. We can come back for Julia once he's gone.

recruit-talk.speaker: Julia
recruit-talk.line: ......Nnh... Lord Seliph?! I... why am I here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Seliph
recruit-talk.line: You can thank Manfroy's dark arts. He brainwashed you into his service.

recruit-talk.speaker: Julia
recruit-talk.line: Manfroy... Oh, that's right... That man who caught me...

recruit-talk.speaker: Seliph
recruit-talk.line: It's fine, Julia. I know. Lewyn already told me everything. I'm sorry... I am so sorry. I failed to protect you...

recruit-talk.speaker: Julia
recruit-talk.line: No... It's fine. Don't worry, Seliph. I finally know why I've survived for all these years. I know my fate... I'm fated to fight. I'll never run away again!

recruit-talk.speaker: Seliph
recruit-talk.line: Your strength and courage is such an inspiration, Julia... But you're right. This is the will of fate, tragic as it is. None can afford to cower or flee now. Until the bitter end, we must march on…

boss.speaker: Julius
boss.line: GHARRGH... SELIPH... HEAR ME WELL... SO LONG AS AVARICE LURKS STILL IN THE HEARTS OF MEN... I WILL RETURN... COUNT ON IT... THE HEARTS OF... GAAAAHHhhh…

boss.speaker: Julius
boss.line: GHARRGH... NAGA! YET AGAIN... YOU HAVE BROUGHT RUIN... TO ME…
